description:
Armoured Assault is a tank battle game of the orthodox style which is enjoyed to this day. Two players start out in their home bases, with the simple goal of destroying the opposing tank. Each tank can take three hits before it is destroyed. Chasing each other uses up fuel reserves as well, and when the fuel gauge reaches zero, the tank is destroyed. The number of shots available is also limited. The screen is filled with barriers to hide behind, but each barrier has a hole in it which can be passed through both by shots and tanks.

Eight modes of play are available:1. Each tank has two reload zones for fuel and one for bullets. - The middle of the screen has a first aid zone which repairs the armour of any tank passing over it. - None of the special features mentioned above. - All the features of modes 1 and 2 combined. - Like mode 1, but with four invincible computer-controlled tanks roaming the screen. - Mode 2 with computer tanks. - Mode 3 with computer tanks. - Mode 4 with computer tanks.

sample_screenshots.caption: (Mode 5) The blue tanks come out to hunt

title: Armoured Assault

description:
This is a simple, top-down simulation of minigolf. Do not expect any of the extravagancies found on some luxury minigolf park; this is more in line with what can be found on a camping ground in the middle of nowhere. The entire course encompasses 9 holes.

Using joystick or cursor keys, a white dot representing the club is moved around a black dot representing the ball. This indicates angle, and the distance from the ball sets the putting force. Putting the ball in the hole in as few strokes as possible is your objective: less than 8 strokes gives higher scores and more than 12 strokes yields no points at all.

sample_screenshots.caption: The little small dot represents the club
Course 2 with a corner and an obstacle

title: Mini Golf

description:
Crazy Teeth is based on Pac-Man, but takes a lot of liberties with the original concept.

The player control a green creature with a big mouth in a labyrinth filled with edible dots. From a door on the right, vicious creatures with sharp teeth enter the maze. The power pills of the original Pac-Man are not present; instead there is a bar on the top of the screen. Eating dots fills up the bar, and when it has reached a certain level, the player may eat the enemy. The maze has a few different items, such as apples and hamburgers. These carry a much higher value than a single dot, allowing the player to greatly increase the power bar at the top. The bar diminishes at all times, forcing the player to eat more in order to stay invincible.

Two other items exist in the maze: A stop sign and a key, both of which can be picked up and carried around. The enemies can't pass the stop sign, which allows you to seal paths and keep the enemy away. The key must be carried to the locked door on the left side of the screen. As you carry items, your speed is slowed to a crawl. Taking the key to the door lets you pass to the next maze.

sample_screenshots.caption: When you flash, you can eat enemies

title: Crazy Teeth

description: Acutype is an educational game in which the player must try and keep up with the computer. Letters and numbers will appear in a square box on the screen. The player must press the corresponding letter or number to remove it again from the box. When pressing the wrong key or waiting too long more characters will enter the box creating longer and longer strings that must be typed. When the box is full the player loses the game. The game is aimed at learning and improving typing speed and accuracy.
title: Acutype

description: Number Game is a mathematical puzzle game in which the player must try to outwit the computer. The object for both the computer and the player is to score as many points as possible. The game will show a list of numbers. The player may pick any number from the list and receive points equal to the number. The computer may then however pick out all numbers from the list which are factors from the number chosen by the player. This equals his score. The player must try to find numbers which are prime numbers or have only few factors in order to win the computer.
title: Number Game

description:
In New York Bomb Blitz, the player is an invader from the planet TROK and assigned to destroy the city of New York. Unfortunately the player's warp drive was damaged in an asteroid belt, thus the player descends slowly. If anyone in New York is still alive when the player lands it is certain death, so there's no other option than to destroy all buildings before the time is up.

The player can drop bombs one at a time to level buildings. Successfully completing a level unlocks new levels with higher difficulties.
title: New York Bomb Blitz

description: With the Graphic Chess game you can play against the computer. There are two levels of difficulty to choose from.
title: Graphic Chess

description: Hubert is a port of the classic arcade game Q*Bert. You must jump to all of the cubes in the pyramid, visited cubes are marked with a circle. It comes with some additions compared to the original. You'll get bonus score if you catch the box that is shown in the pyramid.
title: Hubert

description:
Larv is Swedish for larva, and as the name suggests, it's a "snake" game. Steer your larva, growing as it is eating dots, without colliding with yourself or the walls. The larva grows for each fifth dot it eats, and once it reaches 100 segments, it starts off in a new labyrinth. Colliding doesn't instantly kill the larva, only giving it a concussion, costing it a brain cell.

The game can be played by one or two players. In the competitive two player mode, the objective is to make the opposing player collide.

There are several settings, such as the density of the labyrinth, the growth rate and the screen colours.
title: Larv: Competition

description: Masken means "the worm" in Swedish, and this is another "snake" game. You must guide your worm around a playfield filled with spades, hearts and clubs, giving respectively 5, 10 and 15 points as well as growing your worm. Avoid the squares, which cost you 20 points. A special bonus item gives another five free points. As usual, the objective is to grow as long as possible, scoring as many points as possible. The number of items on the playfield grows along with your worm. Controls are via the Swedish "snake" standard of M and Z for turning clockwise and counter-clockwise.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's not very well programmed – I grew so much I caused a score overflow

title: Masken

description:
In this Swedish text adventure, you are Indiana Jones, and it is up to you to recover King Arthur's sword, the Excalibur. The area you are in is filled with dangers such as lions, crocodiles, quicksand and tarantulas, and you are only armed with a compass. The area contains both old castles and a pyramid, as well as a mysterious forest.

Although the game is entirely text-based, apart from the title screen, it does have sound effects.

sample_screenshots.caption: You stand in a forest in front of a large rock
You find a knife near the creek

title: Explorer III

description: A basic Breakout clone made in BASIC. The ball physics and collision detection is also very basic. What separates it from the most orthodox Breakout variants is that there are two simultaneous paddles, each covering one horizontal half of the screen, and that the paddles move upward when a row of blocks is destroyed.
title: Spectra Break

description: In this avoid-em-up made in BASIC, you control a little ball that must navigate five labyrinths filled with moving traps to pick up red dots and crosses. Once you've picked up all dots, the door to the next level opens. Control is via the keyboard, and there is a lot of intertia, making timing quite difficult.

sample_screenshots.caption: You are the blue ball in the top left corner

title: Sweewos Partner

description: In Bomb Man, which has no relation to Hudson's famous Bomberman, you play as a hat-clad yellow man who must disarm the bombs placed on the screen by a green man. The green man hunts you as you go around the screen, and if you don't move in a careful fashion, he will corner you. Bushes may slow down the green man's steps. Sometimes, the green man will tire, and you will have a bonus screen where you can go about disarming bombs at your own pace.
title: Bomb Man

description: An implementation of Conway's Game of Life for the Spectravideo 318/328. You can make your own starting cell pattern or watch the preprogrammed iterating pattern.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose to design your own or use the preset pattern

title: Game of Life

description: You are a bird that likes to eat cherries (which float in the air). Use the joystick or space bar to flap your wings and climb and steer using joystick or cursor keys to eat the cherries while avoiding the other birds. If you eat all the cherries, the other birds turn into cherries as a bonus. At 500 points, the difficulty level rises, and at 700 points you gain an extra life.
title: Hollow

description: Though the title may sound like a card game, this Solitaire is an elimination board game. On a cross-shaped playfield filled with X'es, you must move a cursor so that it is next to an X, then press the space key to jump across it. However, the cursor must land in an empty square. By doing so, that X is eliminated, and the game is clear once only one X remains, preferably in the middle of the screen.
title: Solitaire

description: Conversely to the title, Ballbounce doesn't involve bouncing a ball, but simply rolling it, which is far from easy. In a vein similar to, but not obviously inspired by Marble Madness, you must guide a ball toward its goal on a pseudo-3D-projected screen. The ball's inertia, in combination with the many platform edges to roll off, makes for a challenging game. All action takes place on one screen without scrolling, and you must reach the goal before time runs out, or your opponent does it before you.
title: Ballbounce

description: The followup to Diamond Luis continues in the Boulder Dash fashion. It has the same graphics as the first game, but even more fiendish puzzles this time around. In addition, the game features a level editor.
title: Diamond Luis 2

description: You must cross the graveyard late at night, but amongst the labyrinthine tombstones are ghosts that may scare you to death. In order to reach the exit, you must avoid the ghosts or keep them away by digging holes. At the easy difficulty level, ghosts may fall into the holes; at high difficulty, they merely stop. Though it may be tempting to dig a ring of holes around you to keep the ghosts at bay, you must hurry so that you reach the exit before the clock strikes twelve.

sample_screenshots.caption: You're scared to death by a ghost
There you are, digging holes in the graveyard

title: Grave Digger

description:
Blastar is a shoot-em-up that was written by Elon Musk when he was just twelve years old. The player controls a spaceship on a mission to destroy alien freighters carrying deadly hydrogen bombs and "status beam machines".

The player starts off with 5 ships (lives). If the player's ship passes directly above or below an alien ship, the alien ship may trap the player in a "status beam". If the player is directly below the alien ship when the status beam is activated, they will be destroyed, but if the player is above, they will be freed after a few moments. The player's ship can move anywhere on the playing field, while the alien ships can only move from left to right. Alien ships can be destroyed by firing an upwards-moving energy blast from the player's ship, but only one energy blast can exist at any one time; if the player fires a new blast, the previous blast will disappear. 80 points are awarded for the destruction of each alien ship. The aim of the game is to survive as long as possible and destroy as many alien ships as possible.
title: Blastar
